definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
to kill/to murder/to attack/to weaken or reduce/to smart (dialect)/(used after a verb) extremely
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: He stressed he had the power of life and death over the hostages in the building.
sentences.chinese: 他强调他对大楼内的人质有生杀大权。

sentences.english: They hold the power of life and death over millions.
sentences.chinese: 他们掌握着数百万人的生杀大权。

sentences.english: The skill of the disease could save lives, book in hand.
sentences.chinese: 得这种病的人能否保住性命，生杀大权在阎王爷手中。

definition: to be in a position of power
lit. to hide the sky with one hand/to hide the truth from the masses
in charge (of a position etc)/the person in charge/responsible
variant of 尚方劍|尚方剑[shang4 fang1 jian4]/imperial sword (giving bearer arbitrary powers)/in fiction, Chinese version of 007's license to kill
bowed head and ears glued (idiom); docile and obedient/at sb's beck and call
property ownership or right/financial power/financial control
